intro: Peperomia parastriata, commonly known as the silver peperomia, is a compact, evergreen perennial native to tropical regions of South America. It features glossy, dark green leaves with a striking silvery or white margin, giving it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically green or reddish in color. It thrives in bright, indirect light and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot. Peperomia parastriata is popular as a houseplant due to its low maintenance and attractive foliage.
